pullRequest.body:
This new `TensorProduct.liftAddHom` doesn't require bilinearity, only that scalar multiplication can be moved between the arguments.

While in theory we only need the `AddMonoidHom` version as it offers exactly the same generality, we first provide an unbundled `liftFun` as this seems to give a sizeable performance boost if used in downstream `lift` variants.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #8571
- [x] depends on: #8584

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: times out at `AlgebraCat.forgetâ‚‚_map_associator_inv`, but `set_option maxHeartbeats 250000` is already enough to fix the timeout
@jjaassoonn, feel free to push that heartbeat fix. I have some ideas to fix the office regression, but am done for the day, and they can always go in a follow up PR.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/b27e86ec-7d88-43df-8813-550b711e85ed) for commit 07b9063331745f943f833b291008ba74929f3d42.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/563023e4-f686-4800-ae65-370556f009c4/to/b27e86ec-7d88-43df-8813-550b711e85ed) against commit 34ab8d46e2122dd9a5600e735c01237adb448b6a:
```diff
  Benchmark                                             Metric         Change
  ===========================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.AlgebraCat.Monoidal         instructions    40.4%
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.ChangeOfRings     instructions     2.4%
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Monoidal.Basic    instructions     8.8%
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Monoidal.Closed   instructions    79.5%
+ ~Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.DirectSum.TensorProduct        instructions   -22.8%
```

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
Split to #8550

```suggestion
/-- Lift an `R`-balanced map to the tensor product.

A map `f : M â†’+ N â†’+ P` additive in both components is `R`-balanced, or middle linear with respect
to `R`, if scalar multiplication in either argument is equivalent, `f m (r â€¢ n) = f (r â€¢ m) n`.

Note that strictly the first action should be a right-action by `R`, but for now `R` is commutative
so it doesn't matter. -/
```

See D&F (2004), definition at top of p.365.
Too late? This was already merged, in #8584
Feel free to make a new PR correcting the docstring on master
Now merged into this PR.
